nodes.bodyText:
This makes me wonder whether users would expect to see both POST and GET returned for the same OPTIONS request, since POST is available for "/test", but GET is only available for "/test/{id}".
For example, if a user does "OPTIONS /test/123", if the available methods in the response header included POST, then that might make a user think they could send a request "POST /test/123", but in this case, that wouldn't work - but "GET /test/123" would.  Likewise, if they did "OPTIONS /test", if they get back POST and GET, they will only be able to do "POST /test" successfully.
The seems to imply that users should expect class- and method-specific metadata from OPTIONS - it says (section 3.3.5):
On receipt of an OPTIONS request an implementation MUST either:
  1. Call a method annotated with a request method designator for OPTIONS or, if none present,
  2. GenerateanautomaticresponseusingthemetadataprovidedbytheJAX-RSannotationsonthematch-
ing class and its methods.
Andy - I thought the same thing as I was coding it.  I will dig into making that fix.  Thanks

These don't look right.  Are you seeing Java 2 security failures without these? If so, I think we might need to add doPriv blocks in the runtime code to address - I don't see anywhere in the test case (application) code where it is getting a classloader or looking up an org.apache.* system property.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,13 @@
+<server>
+    <featureManager>
+        <feature>jaxrs-2.0</feature>        
+        <feature>componenttest-1.0</feature>
+    </featureManager>
+
+  	<include location="../fatTestPorts.xml"/>
+  	
+	<javaPermission className="java.net.SocketPermission" name="*" actions="connect,resolve"/>
+    <javaPermission className="java.util.PropertyPermission" name="org.apache.commons.logging.*" actions="read"/>
+    <javaPermission className="java.lang.RuntimePermission" name="getClassLoader"/>

nodes.bodyText: Yes I am seeing Java 2 security failures. I needed to add these for the DefaultHttpClient.  I will remove my use of DefaultHttpClient.
